edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores

Class GlusterFileStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores.AbstractBlockStore
      • edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.stores.GlusterFileStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BlockStore, FileStore, RemoteFileStore

    @ThreadSafe
public final class GlusterFileStore
extends AbstractBlockStore
implements RemoteFileStore
    Stores blocks in a mounted GlusterFS volume. Because the data is stored in remote files and globally accessed by multiple nodes, each access (write, read, or deletion) for a file needs one instance of FileBlock. These accesses are judiciously synchronized by the metadata server in master.

      • putPartitions

        public <K extends Serializable> Optional<List<Long>> putPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                   Iterable<NonSerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                                   boolean commitPerPartition)
                                                            throws BlockWriteException
        Saves an iterable of data partitions to a block.
        Specified by:
        putPartitions in interface BlockStore
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to write a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
        See Also:
        BlockStore.putPartitions(String, Iterable, boolean)

      • putSerializedPartitions

        public <K extends Serializable> List<Long> putSerializedPartitions(String blockId,
                                                                   Iterable<SerializedPartition<K>> partitions,
                                                                   boolean commitPerPartition)
                                                            throws BlockWriteException
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Saves an iterable of SerializedPartitions to a block. If the block exists already, appends the data to it. Invariant: This method may not support concurrent write for a single block. Only one thread have to write at once.
        Specified by:
        putSerializedPartitions in interface BlockStore
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the partitions.
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        partitions - to save to a block.
        commitPerPartition - whether commit every partition write or not.
        Returns:
        the size of the data per partition (only when the data is serialized).
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - for any error occurred while trying to write a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
        See Also:
        BlockStore.putSerializedPartitions(String, Iterable, boolean)

      • commitBlock

        public void commitBlock(String blockId)
                 throws BlockWriteException
        Description copied from interface: BlockStore
        Notifies that all writes for a block is end. Subscribers waiting for the data of the target block are notified when the block is committed. Also, further subscription about a committed block will not blocked but get the data in it and finished.
        Specified by:
        commitBlock in interface BlockStore
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        Throws:
        BlockWriteException - if fail to commit. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
        See Also:
        BlockStore.commitBlock(String)

      • removeBlock

        public Boolean removeBlock(String blockId)
                    throws BlockFetchException
        Removes the file that the target block is stored.
        Specified by:
        removeBlock in interface BlockStore
        Parameters:
        blockId - of the block.
        Returns:
        whether the block exists or not.
        Throws:
        BlockFetchException - for any error occurred while trying to remove a block. (This exception will be thrown to the scheduler through Executor and have to be handled by the scheduler with fault tolerance mechanism.)
